name: Officer Armstrong*

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: It's a shame you've got to go. But you'll do okay out there, I'm sure.{Firm}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong ShameYouveG…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_ShameYouveGot.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I mean, I just had a hunch she was in trouble.
topics.response_text: Maybe. She isn't the only one, that's for sure.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong SheIsntTheO…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_SheIsntTheOnly.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: That's a risk I'm willing to take.
topics.response_text: Technically, this means I'm supposed to report her. To tell the truth, I'm supposed to report you being here, too.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong Technically…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_TechnicallyThisMeans.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Can you lead me somewhere?
topics.response_text: I guess you've had a lot on your mind since you were here last. Where do you want to go?Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong GuessYouveH…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_GuessYouveHad.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: This is too messed up. I'm leaving again. Just pretend I never came back.
topics.response_text: Well, I can't blame you. I'll change the passwords behind you, and we'll figure out a way to work things out for ourselves.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong CantBlameYo…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_CantBlameYou.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I can take it from here.
topics.response_text: If you want to go on alone, it's your call.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong WantToGoOn.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_WantToGoOn.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I need to see Amata. Lead me to her.
topics.response_text: Okay, follow me.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong FollowMe.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_FollowMe.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I think I'd like to have a talk with the Overseer. Take me to him.
topics.response_text: Okay, follow me.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong FollowMe.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_FollowMe.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: What sort of trouble do you mean?
topics.response_text: Let me bring you up to speed. It seems like it's been a mighty long time.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong BringYouUp.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_BringYouUp.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: What's happened down here since I left?
topics.response_text: Everything went crazy, is what happened. Your dad opened that door, bugs started attacking, and people started going crazy.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong EverythingW…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_EverythingWentCrazy.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I always knew something would go wrong down here...
topics.response_text: It wouldn't have if your father hadn't ruined everything by opening that door!Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong ItWouldntHa…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_ItWouldntHave.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: That was never supposed to happen! That was the Overseer's fault!
topics.response_text: Really? Well, that would explain a few things, all right. It's a good thing you're here, after all.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong ThatWouldEx…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_ThatWouldExplain.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Dad would be horrified to know all that... if he were still alive.
topics.response_text: I'm... I'm sorry to hear that. Regardless of how things turned out down here, he was a good friend. I always figured he'd do well outside.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong SorryToHear…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_SorryToHearThat.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Yeah, Dad screwed up all of our lives that day, didn't he?
topics.response_text: To tell the truth, I don't really blame him for all that. I don't know why he left, but I do know he'd never intend for all that to happen.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong ToTellTheTr…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_ToTellTheTruth.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: So what now?
topics.response_text: I probably ought to put you under arrest and take you in to the Overseer, but frankly, I know better than to try that.{emphasis on "supposed", as if he doesn't really agree with it.}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong OughtToPutY…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_OughtToPutYou.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Well, let me through. I've got work to do.
topics.response_text: I can't do that. Not officially, at least. As much as some of the rebels would like to talk with you, the Overseer said you weren't welcome back.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong CantDoThat.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_CantDoThat.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: There's only one solution, here. Death, and lots of it. You get to be first!
topics.response_text: What?Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong What.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_What.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I need to talk with Amata. I got her message.
topics.response_text: Amata's message? I don't know what you're talking about, but I'd keep that under your hat, for her sake.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong AmatasMessa…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_AmatasMessage.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I just thought I'd stop back home for a bit. How's the old Vault?
topics.response_text: You just thought you'd pop in? Don't take this the wrong way, but you probably ought to just turn around and not come back.{Incredulous}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong YouJustThou…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_YouJustThought.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Don't mind me. I'm just here to pick up some stuff I left behind.
topics.response_text: This isn't some sort of hotel, you know! You don't just come and go as you please. I thought you were raised better than that!Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong ThisIsntSom…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_ThisIsntSomeSort.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Where the hell is Amata? So help me, if you've hurt her...
topics.response_text: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Calm down, there. Amata's not in any danger.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong WhoaAWhoaWh…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_WhoaAWhoaWhoa.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I can't solve your problems for you. You're on your own.
topics.response_text: And here I was hoping you'd be able to help. Well, I hope you have better luck outside.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong HereIWasHop…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_HereIWasHoping.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: I still don't get what's going on.
topics.response_text: Okay, let's try this slowly. When you and your daddy left, there were problems. Those problems were bad.{As if talking to a child.}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong LetsTryThis…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_LetsTryThisSlowly.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: So, who's the Overseer now?
topics.response_text: That'd be Allen Mack. You remember, Wally's dad.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong ThatdBeAlle…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_ThatdBeAllen.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: On second thought, I'm not leaving this place to its fate.
topics.response_text: That's good to hear, kid. I'll do what I can to keep the door unlocked for you, but the rest is up to you.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong GoodToHear.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_GoodToHear.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Wait, why don't the rebels just leave?
topics.response_text: It's not that they want to leave. It's that they want to open the door and interact with the rest of the world. But that would risk the whole Vault.{A little wary about the plan.}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong NotThatThey…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_NotThatTheyWant.oggnoicon

conversation.topic_text: I'll go see what I can do about all of this.
conversation.response_text: Well, okay. Just be careful down here. The Vault's changed, I tell you.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong JustBeCaref…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_JustBeCareful.oggnoicon
Uh oh. Wait here. This doesn't look good.Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong WaitHere.ogghttps://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_WaitHere.oggnoicon

Taylor, stop shooting, damnit!{Furious and terrified that his friend is shooting at his son.}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong TaylorStopS…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_TaylorStopShooting.oggnoicon

Amata's up there, in the clinic with the rest of them. I'd take you closer, but they don't get along with security. Good luck.{Worried, but well-meaning}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong AmatasUpThe…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_AmatasUpThere.oggnoicon

Visitor, sir. He wanted to see you, and... well, there's not much I could do to stop him.{Very worried - is sure that something very bad is about to go down.}Play soundFO3 OfficerArmstrong HeWantedToS…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_OfficerArmstrong_HeWantedToSee.oggnoicon

description:
Officer Armstrong is a 32 year-old African American Male.

A dedicated security officer in Vault 101, Armstrong has been trying to maintain order within the vault since the doctor's disappearance. He values security protocols and is concerned about the well-being of vault residents, especially following the recent crisis that claimed multiple lives.

Officer Armstrong's Personality: Dutiful, loyal, and pragmatic. Armstrong takes his security responsibilities seriously but also shows genuine concern for his fellow vault dwellers. He respects authority but isn't blindly obedient, making decisions based on what he believes is best for Vault 101.

Officer Armstrong's Backstory: Born and raised in Vault 101, Officer Armstrong has spent his entire life within the vault's confines. He joined the security team at a young age and has risen through the ranks to become one of the more experienced security personnel. He developed a friendship with Oversear's son, James, and respected him both as a friend and as a fellow vault dweller. When the doctor disappeared, Armstrong took it upon himself to help maintain order during the subsequent crisis, though he often found himself stretched thin by the demands of his position.
